newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Pasminco sees Budel licence by yr-end.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Pasminco sees Budel licence by yr-end.

text.p: Pasminco Ltd said on Thursday it expected to receive an extension of the waste dumping licence for its Budel zinc smelter in the Netherlands by the end of 1996.

"We are not anticipating any major objections. We would expect to have that formal licence extension by the end of the year," managing director David Stewart told a Securities Institute of Australia luncheon.
Budel's licence to store waste jarosite expires in July 1988 but it has sought a two year extension from the Dutch Government due to problems with the Century mine project in Queensland.

Century, a A$1 billion project owned by CRA Ltd/RTZ Plc, has faced aboriginal land claims which are now being negotiated with the company under the terms of Australian government's native title legislation.
The low-iron zinc from the mine, which was initially due to begin production in 1996, was central to Pasminco's plan to eliminate production of the jarosite waste by-product at Budel.
Stewart said he believed the result of the native title talks should be known by the middle to the end of 1997.
He said he expected that the outcome would be for the mine to proceed. -- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800
